verses.text: \sc In\sc* the eighth month, in the second year of Darius, came the word of the \sc Lord\sc* unto Zechariah, the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet, saying,
The \sc Lord\sc* hath been sore displeased with your fathers.
Therefore say thou unto them, Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts; Turn ye unto me, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, And I will turn unto you, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts.

Be ye not as your fathers, unto whom the former prophets have cried, saying, Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts; Turn ye now from your evil ways, and \add from\add* your evil doings: But they did not hear, nor hearken unto me, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
Your fathers, where \add are\add* they? And the prophets, do they live for ever?

But my words and my statutes, which I commanded my servants the prophets, Did they not take hold of your fathers? And they returned and said, Like as the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts thought to do unto us, According to our ways, and according to our doings, so hath he dealt with us.

Upon the four and twentieth day of the eleventh month, which \add is\add* the month Sebat, in the second year of Darius, came the word of the \sc Lord\sc* unto Zechariah, the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet, saying,
I saw by night, and behold a man riding upon a red horse, and he stood among the myrtle trees that \add were\add* in the bottom; and behind him \add were there\add* red horses, speckled, and white.
Then said I, O my lord, what \add are\add* these? And the angel that talked with me said unto me, I will shew thee what these \add be\add*.
And the man that stood among the myrtle trees answered and said, These \add are they\add* whom the \sc Lord\sc* hath sent to walk to and fro through the earth.
And they answered the angel of the \sc Lord\sc* that stood among the myrtle trees, and said, We have walked to and fro through the earth, and behold, all the earth sitteth still, and is at rest.

Then the angel of the \sc Lord\sc* answered and said, O \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, how long wilt thou not have mercy on Jerusalem and on the cities of Judah, \add against\add* which thou hast had indignation these threescore and ten years?
And the \sc Lord\sc* answered the angel that talked with me \add with\add* good words \add and\add* comfortable words.
So the angel that communed with me said unto me, Cry thou, saying, Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts; I am jealous for Jerusalem and for Zion \add with\add* a great jealousy.
And I am very sore displeased with the heathen \add that are\add* at ease: For I was \add but\add* a little displeased, and they helped forward the affliction.
Therefore thus saith the \sc Lord\sc*; I am returned to Jerusalem with mercies: My house shall be built in it, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, And a line shall be stretched forth upon Jerusalem.
Cry yet, saying, Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts; My cities through prosperity shall yet be spread abroad; And the \sc Lord\sc* shall yet comfort Zion, And shall yet choose Jerusalem.
Then lift I up mine eyes, and saw, and behold four horns.
And I said unto the angel that talked with me, What \add be\add* these? And he answered me, These \add are\add* the horns which have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.
And the \sc Lord\sc* shewed me four carpenters.

Then said I, What come these to do? And he spake, saying, These \add are\add* the horns which have scattered Judah, so that no man did lift up his head: but these are come to fray them, to cast out the horns of the Gentiles, which lift up \add their\add* horn over the land of Judah to scatter it.
